mosinstall.description:
Is a plugin for Ajaxifying Joomla. It makes content of your website load faster than ever without reloading the whole page.

You can see the demo here : http://demo.web2coder.com 

 

Joomlajax has the following features:

 

  1. It is compatible with every Joomla templates.
  2. It can dynamically include, execute and exclude third-party scripts that may exist inside components and plugins.
  3. It has a Bookmarking button that you can book mark any page whenever you want!
  4. You will be able to disable/enable ajax loading.
  5. Pathway will be dynamically changed.
  6. It is successfully tested by FireFox 2.0.0.3 and MSIE 7.
  7. You can change the encoding system of loading your content (By default it is UTF-8)
  8. In the case that any errors occurs it would automatically reload the page (or you can disable this feature).
  9. It automatically recognize external links so that they would not get loaded.

Please make sure to follow the instruction below:


  • Disable any SEF ( Search Engine Friendly ) or any SEO Components or Plugin that may exist in your joomla ( You can Disable SEO in Joomla Global Configuration area )
  • Do not use templates that use JavaScript Toolkit/Libraries. it makes joomlajax not work in some cases
  • We advice you to Disable component/mambots that includes any JavaScript Toolkit like jQuery, Mootools & ... ( However if you want to use them. Check if it works correctly with Joomlajax )
  • Important!:If you want to have mosPathway loads dynamically you can add these lines before <?php mosMainBody(); ?> in your index2.php:
    Please note that doing this is at your own risk and you can revert it back by simply comment or deleting the following codes in Index2.php <div id="pathway">
    <div id="pathway_text">
    <?php mosPathWay(); ?>
    </div>
    </div>
  • In the case that any page doesn't get loaded correctly or the page doesn't get loaded dynamically it is because of third party scripts that interfere the work of Joomlajax. You can disable the "redirection of page in the error case" in Pajax.js script in: mambot->system->Joomlaxcore. Simply find "redirect(rdurl);" and comment it like "//redirect(rdurl);"

For any problem or question please visit Joomlajax Dedicated forum at http://forum.web2coder.com
